channel.name: Slimy Skull (Slime Boss relic) - Daily Discussion 27 Nov

messages.content:
Next Daily Discussion: #deleted-channel

__Votes__:
Receive Tribute (Collector card): 0

Spectre's Hand (Champ relic): 6

embeds.title: Slimy Skull
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Whenever you apply **Goop** :p_goop:, apply an additional 1 **Goop** :p_goop:.
*A Snecko skull in absolutely awful condition. Unclean and slimy, dirt and grime stick to it like glue.*

messages.content: this feels worse than snecko skull

embeds.title: Snecko Skull
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Silent / Slay the Spire

Whenever you apply Poison :p_poison:, apply an additional 1 Poison :p_poison:.
*A snecko skull in pristine condition. Mysteriously clean and smooth, dirt and grime fall off inexplicably.*

messages.content: I think I'm happier when I see snecko skull
even though slime boss has licks
It's certainly not a useless relic but it has pretty low impact. Being worse than snecko skull makes sense cause each point of poison is theoretically one more turn
Yeah, this is worse than a Vajra but not useless, which is a reasonable place for some relics to be. Perfectly fine design to fill out the weaker end of the normal curve

Apply 3 Poison :p_poison: to a random enemy 3 (4) times.

 (Draw a card.)

embeds.description:
Rare Power / 2 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
Whenever you play a card with **Command,** **Command** again.

messages.content: these are all the synergies with snecko skull I can think of

embeds.title: Spreading Slime
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 2 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Effects that apply **Goop** :p_goop: apply 2 (3) more.

embeds.title: Slimy Elixir
embeds.description:
Uncommon Potion / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Whenever an effect applies Goop this combat, apply 2 more.

footer.text: <apply more goop this combat potion> = slimy elixir, 180.02

embeds.title: Ooze Bath
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Apply 6 (9) **Goop** :p_goop: to target enemy at the start of each of its turns.
**Exhaust**.

embeds.title: Lick
embeds.description:
Special Skill / 0 :colorless_energy: / Colorless / Downfall

Apply 4 (6) **Goop** :p_goop:.
**Exhaust** - **Buried.**

messages.content: that's not a synergy, it's just +1 there
like how snecko skull works multiple times with bouncing flask

embeds.title: Gluttony
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
The first time you **Consume** each turn, gain a Lick.

messages.content: that's like saying vajra synergizes with infinite blades

embeds.title: Just Desserts
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 5 (8) damage to ALL enemies.
**Exhume** 2 random "Lick" cards.

messages.content: yeah I guess it works twice
<waste not> also but works but also is mid so don't draft it

embeds.title: Schlurp

Common Skill / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

messages.content: Completely forgot about this common card
and a bit mid into sentries
Artifact strip can be useful if you have an aoe debuffs card

embeds.title: Goop Spray
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Apply 5 (8) **Goop** :p_goop: and 1 **Weak** :p_weak: to ALL enemies.

messages.content: Which is above average for a common but still really bad in Act 1
pickable if you alr fought nob
That is if he is the second elite (if your on a 3 elite path)
And yeah it's definitely top tier into laga

Spreading slime is very consistently an excellent card for slime boss decks, so getting a relic version that guarantees you 1 stack at the start of every fight without having to draw a card or spend any energy is quite good. It may not be the absolute flashiest of relics, but it is only a common, and there are some very solid synergies with rain of goop, lick recursion/spam, and creating multiple mire slimes. Especially nice if you have douse in slime or slime slap to benefit from the stacking multiple times, leeching strike for additional block, or vicious tackle to multiply the value of the goop. I'm usually very happy to see this, and even if your deck isn't heavily into goop synergies (which is fairly rare) it still provides reasonable value as a common. It will usually tend to do better later on in the run, when you have more of a chance to have acquired some of the stronger synergies and build your deck around goop stacking. It also helps that fights are longer since enemies have more health at that point, which means more chances to trigger this for extra goop and have the scaling be relevant. Runic pyramid specifically can make this much better if you can stall a fight and wait until you draw douse in slime or slime slap to not remove the goop.
